intro: Sclerolaena beaugleholei, commonly known as the Cape sour fig, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by round, fleshy fruits that turn from green to yellow or red as they mature. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils, showcasing its resilience to drought. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though its botanical study remains limited.
